pullRequest.title: Guard against regex and range expansion by default
pullRequest.bodyText:
The DefaultQueryPlanner will attempt to expand regex and bounded ranges
by default, even when no regex nodes exist in the query.
Add a visitor to count each type of node in a query, and use this to
only expand the query when the relevant nodes are present.
Fixes #888

afterCommit.message:
Guard against regex and range expansion by default

The DefaultQueryPlanner will attempt to expand regex and bounded ranges
by default, even when no regex nodes exist in the query.

Add a visitor to count each type of node in a query, and use this to
only expand the query when the relevant nodes are present.

Fixes #888

nodes.bodyText: Given #926 has been merged in, we can now detect bounded ranges precisely.  Update the node counter to also count the different types of QueryPropertyMarkers.  This can then be if (nodeCount.asBoundedRange()).
Do we have to call the visitor every time or can we count the nodes once?  There may be places where we need to recount but certainly not at line 1211
I don't think we need to do this here.  Just do it once after expanding regexes and ranges.
may not need this call as this would not affect the call at 1301.
Don't need this call.  Just call once after expanding regexes and ranges
probably dont' need to do this here.

commit.message:
Guard against regex and range expansion by default

The DefaultQueryPlanner will attempt to expand regex and bounded ranges
by default, even when no regex nodes exist in the query.

Add a visitor to count each type of node in a query, and use this to
only expand the query when the relevant nodes are present.

Fixes #888
Only recount nodes when the query tree is modified
